name: damply
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
in a slightly wet way, especially in a way that is not pleasant or comfortable: His face was flushed, and beads of sweat stood out damply on his brow. When she opened the door, the cold morning air struck her face damply.
More examplesFewer examplesThe surfaces glistened damply where they had been washed down.She sat on the bed and ran her fingers through her damply tangled hair.Her silk blouse was clinging damply against her skin in the heat.
